quote: If you optimize everything, you will always be unhappy.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: Any sufficiently advanced bug is indistinguishable from a feature.
author: Rich Kulawiec

quote: Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.
author: Bill Gates

quote: There are two ways of constructing a software design: One way is to make it so simple that there are obviously no deficiencies, and the other way is to make it so complicated that there are no obvious deficiencies.
author: C.A.R. Hoare

quote: Software is a great combination of artistry and engineering.
author: Bill Gates

quote: If it ain’t broke, don’t fix it.
author: Bert Lantz

quote: To iterate is human, to recurse divine.
author: L. Peter Deutsch

quote: Good code is short, simple, and symmetrical—the challenge is figuring out how to get there.
author: Sean Parent

quote: I have always wished for my computer to be as easy to use as my telephone; my wish has come true because I can no longer figure out how to use my telephone.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

quote: It’s not that I’m so smart, it’s just that I stay with problems longer.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: To be a good software engineer, you must be a good communicator.
author: Andy Hunt

quote: I think that coding is one of the most interesting things that one can do with a computer, but I also believe that it should be as easy to learn as any other interesting thing.
author: Hal Abelson

quote: The key to success is to risk thinking unconventional thoughts. Convention is the enemy of progress. As long as you've got slightly more perception than the average wrapped loaf, you could invent something.
author: Trevor Baylis

quote: Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
author: John Woods

quote: A good programmer is someone who always looks both ways before crossing a one-way street.
author: Doug Linder

quote: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
author: Linus Torvalds

quote: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
author: Kent Beck

quote: The best thing about a boolean is even if you are wrong, you are only off by a bit.
author: Unknown

quote: The most important thing is to be able to think what you want, not to say what you want.
author: Paul Graham

quote: Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve until they actually did it.
author: Patrick McKenzie

quote: Debugging is like an onion. There are multiple layers to it, and the more you peel them back, the more likely you are to start crying at inappropriate times.
author: Unknown

quote: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it’s bad.
author: Cory House

quote: You can’t have great software without a great team, and most software teams behave like dysfunctional families.
author: Jim McCarthy

quote: Programming is the art of telling a computer what to do, but the real challenge is telling other people what you want the computer to do.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
author: Martin Golding

quote: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
author: Martin Fowler

quote: The only way to go fast is to go well.
author: Robert C. Martin

quote: The purpose of abstraction is not to be vague, but to create a new semantic level in which one can be absolutely precise.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

quote: The most important aspect of a software system is its architecture. Architecture is the key to quality and success.
author: Robert C. Martin

quote: Perfection is achieved not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: Good code is its own best documentation.
author: Steve McConnell

quote: Code never lies, comments sometimes do.
author: Ron Jeffries

quote: In software, the only difference between theory and practice is whether it works or not.
author: Sandy Kemsley

quote: The key to success in software development is to never stop learning.
author: John Sonmez

quote: It's hard enough to find an error in your code when you're looking for it; it's even harder when you've assumed your code is error-free.
author: Steve McConnell

quote: Computers are incredibly fast, accurate, and stupid. Human beings are incredibly slow, inaccurate, and brilliant. Together they are powerful beyond imagination.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: If you want to change the world, change the code.
author: Unknown

quote: The best way to predict your future is to program it.
author: Alan Kay

quote: Software is a great combination of artistry and engineering.
author: Bill Gates

quote: It’s not at all important to get it right the first time. It’s vitally important to get it right the last time.
author: Andrew Hunt and David Thomas

quote: Any code of your own that you haven’t looked at for six or more months might as well have been written by someone else.
author: Eagleson’s Law

quote: Programmers are constantly making things more complicated than they need to be because future-proofing is impossible.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

quote: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson

quote: Without requirements or design, programming is the art of adding bugs to an empty text file.
author: Louis Srygley

quote: We have to stop optimizing for programmers and start optimizing for users.
author: Jeff Atwood

quote: The cheapest, fastest, and most reliable components are those that aren’t there.
author: Gordon Bell

quote: If you’re not failing, you’re not pushing your limits, and if you’re not pushing your limits, you’re not maximizing your potential.
author: Ray Dalio

quote: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
author: Harold Abelson and Gerald Jay Sussman

quote: Make it correct, make it clear, make it concise, make it fast. In that order.
author: Wes Dyer

quote: You can’t trust code that you did not totally create yourself.
author: Ken Thompson

quote: One of the best programming skills you can have is knowing when to walk away for a while.
author: Oscar Godson

quote: It is better to have 100 functions operate on one data structure than 10 functions on 10 data structures.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it.
author: Dennis Ritchie

quote: In theory, there is no difference between theory and practice. But, in practice, there is.
author: Jan L. A. van de Snepscheut

quote: The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user.
author: C.A.R. Hoare

quote: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Before software can be reusable, it first has to be usable.
author: Ralph Johnson

quote: I’m not a great programmer; I’m just a good programmer with great habits.
author: Kent Beck

quote: If you think good architecture is expensive, try bad architecture.
author: Brian Foote

quote: There are two ways to write error-free programs; only the third one works.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: One of my most productive days was throwing away 1000 lines of code.
author: Ken Thompson

quote: The only source of knowledge is experience.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The purpose of software engineering is to control complexity, not to create it.
author: Pamela Zave

quote: Software is a gas; it expands to fill its container.
author: Nathan Myhrvold

quote: Good code is its own best documentation. As you’re about to add a comment, ask yourself, ‘How can I improve the code so that this comment isn’t needed?'
author: Steve McConnell

quote: The art of debugging is figuring out what you really told your program to do rather than what you thought you told it to do.
author: Andrew Singer

quote: The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user.
author: C.A.R. Hoare

quote: Don’t worry if it doesn’t work right. If everything did, you’d be out of a job.
author: Mosher’s Law of Software Engineering

quote: If at first you don't succeed, call it version 1.0.
author: Unknown

quote: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

quote: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
author: Harold Abelson and Gerald Jay Sussman

quote: I think there is a world market for maybe five computers.
author: Thomas Watson

quote: We build our computer systems the way we build our cities: over time, without a plan, on top of ruins.
author: Ellen Ullman

quote: The strength of JavaScript is that you can do anything. The weakness is that you will.
author: Reg Braithwaite

quote: A language that doesn’t have everything is actually easier to program in than some that do.
author: Dennis M. Ritchie

quote: Computers are like bikinis. They save people a lot of guesswork.
author: Sam Ewing

quote: If you automate a mess, you get an automated mess.
author: Rod Michael

quote: Code is a story that explains how the problem was solved.
author: Kasia Kaczmarek

quote: If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.
author: African Proverb

quote: Premature optimization is the root of all evil.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: Software is a great combination of artistry and engineering.
author: Bill Gates

quote: The best thing about a boolean is even if you are wrong, you are only off by a bit.
author: Anonymous

quote: Programming is not about typing, it's about thinking.
author: Rich Hickey

quote: Code never lies, comments sometimes do.
author: Ron Jeffries

quote: If you don't have time to do it right, when will you have time to do it over?
author: John Wooden

quote: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: The best code is no code at all.
author: Jeff Atwood

quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: The only way to go fast is to go well.
author: Robert C. Martin

quote: If debugging is the process of removing software bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

quote: The best code is code that never has to be written.
author: Unknown

quote: You can’t have great software without a great team, and most software teams behave like dysfunctional families.
author: Jim McCarthy

quote: Learning to program has no more to do with designing interactive software than learning to touch type has to do with writing poetry.
author: Ted Nelson

quote: The best error message is the one that never shows up.
author: Thomas Fuchs

quote: Good code is its own best documentation. As you’re about to add a comment, ask yourself, ‘How can I improve the code so that this comment isn’t needed?'
author: Steve McConnell

quote: Debugging is like being a detective in a crime movie where you are also the murderer.
author: Filipe Fortes

quote: The only code that is easy to maintain is the code that has not yet been written.
author: Robert C. Martin

quote: Programming can be fun, so can cryptography; however, they should not be combined.
author: Kreitzberg and Shneiderman

quote: The most important thing in the programming language is the name. A language will not succeed without a good name. I have recently invented a very good name and now I am looking for a suitable language.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
author: Harold Abelson and Gerald Jay Sussman

quote: Talk is cheap, show me the code.
author: Linus Torvalds

quote: Programs are meant to be read by humans and only incidentally for computers to execute.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: The most disastrous thing that you can ever learn is your first programming language.
author: Alan Kay

quote: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it’s bad.
author: Cory House

quote: If you think good architecture is expensive, try bad architecture.
author: Brian Foote and Joseph Yoder

quote: Programming isn't about what you know; it's about what you can figure out.
author: Chris Pine

quote: The only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven’t found it yet, keep looking. Don’t settle.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: I’m not a great programmer; I’m just a good programmer with great habits.
author: Kent Beck

quote: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson

quote: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
author: Austin Freeman

quote: Perfection is achieved not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: If you can’t explain it to a six-year-old, you don’t understand it yourself.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: A language that doesn’t affect the way you think about programming is not worth knowing.
author: Alan Perlis

quote: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
author: Martin Fowler

quote: There are only two kinds of languages: the ones people complain about and the ones nobody uses.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

quote: The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user.
author: C.A.R. Hoare

quote: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
author: Harold Abelson and Gerald Jay Sussman

quote: Good code is its own best documentation. As you’re about to add a comment, ask yourself, ‘How can I improve the code so that this comment isn’t needed?'
author: Steve McConnell

quote: The best programs are the ones written when the programmer is supposed to be working on something else.
author: Melinda Varian

quote: Programming is not about what you know, it’s about what you can figure out.
author: Chris Pine

quote: Software is a great combination of artistry and engineering.
author: Bill Gates

quote: There's nothing more permanent than a temporary hack.
author: Kyle Simpson

quote: The only thing worse than no code is bad code.
author: Bob Seidensticker

quote: Programming is like sex: one mistake and you have to support it for the rest of your life.
author: Michael Sinz

quote: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
author: Austin Freeman

quote: If at first you don't succeed, call it version 1.0.
author: Unknown

quote: Software is a great combination of artistry and engineering.
author: Bill Gates

quote: The three virtues of a programmer: Laziness, Impatience, and Hubris.
author: Larry Wall

quote: If you think good architecture is expensive, try bad architecture.
author: Brian Foote

quote: In software, the most beautiful code is the one that gets you closer to solving the problem at hand with the least amount of fuss.
author: Jessica Kerr

quote: We are not necessarily thinking machines. We are feeling machines that think.
author: Antonio Damasio

quote: If you can't explain it to a six-year-old, you don't understand it yourself.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Any code of your own that you haven’t looked at for six or more months might as well have been written by someone else.
author: Eagleson’s Law

quote: The biggest mistake I’ve made is not letting go of code that I knew was bad.
author: Joshua Bloch

quote: Debugging is like being the detective in a crime movie where you are also the murderer.
author: Filipe Fortes

quote: If you don’t like how things are, change it! You’re not a tree.
author: Jim Rohn

quote: Programming isn’t about what you know; it’s about what you can figure out.
author: Chris Pine

quote: Code never lies, comments sometimes do.
author: Ron Jeffries

quote: The difference between theory and practice is that in theory, there is no difference between theory and practice.
author: Richard Moore

quote: Good code is its own best documentation. As you’re about to add a comment, ask yourself, ‘How can I improve the code so that this comment isn’t needed?’
author: Steve McConnell

quote: If you can't write it down in English, you can't code it.
author: Peter Halpern

quote: The most important skill a programmer can have is the ability to work with others.
author: Jason Fried

quote: Testing can only prove the presence of bugs, not their absence.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

quote: The purpose of software engineering is to control complexity, not to create it.
author: Pamela Zave

quote: If you don’t write tests, you don’t know if your code works.
author: Unknown

quote: The best way to get a project done faster is to start sooner.
author: Jim Highsmith

quote: Code is read many more times than it is written, plan accordingly.
author: Unknown

quote: Programming is not about typing, it's about thinking.
author: Rich Hickey

quote: I'm convinced that about half of what separates successful entrepreneurs from the non-successful ones is pure perseverance.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: I have no special talent. I am only passionately curious.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it's bad.
author: Cory House

quote: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
author: Harold Abelson and Gerald Jay Sussman

quote: Good programmers use their brains, but good guidelines save us having to think out every case.
author: Francis Glassborow

quote: It's not about how much you know. It's about how fast you can learn.
author: Unknown

quote: The computer was born to solve problems that did not exist before.
author: Bill Gates

quote: If you don’t start somewhere, you’re gonna go nowhere.
author: Bob Marley

quote: Don’t comment bad code – rewrite it.
author: Brian Kernighan

quote: A good programmer is someone who always looks both ways before crossing a one-way street.
author: Doug Linder
